result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections.
To pay back the Buy money.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling as direct by probation agent.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1. 60 days stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Additional 30 days stayed if buy money totaling $1,095 is paid within the 60 day report to jail period. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 60 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew R Smith in court with attorney Grant A Erickson.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Erickson requests a status in 45 days.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Andrew R Smith in court with attorney Grant A Erickson.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Andrew R Smith in court with attorney Grant Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains as is.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/11/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 6/13/14)

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Andrew R Smith appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
